title: Change default mode when opening a message in "Sent" folder
content:
When I click to open a message in the local sent folder, it defaults to "Edit Draft Message", which I hate; it's too easy to accidentally resend the message causing confusion. I want to set the default to "Open message in new window" or "Open message in new tab". I have not found the way to do this. What am I missing?

It's nice to have the option to "Edit Draft Message," but I rarely want that. I'll select it from the context menu when needed.
creator: tech77

title: Account on multiple computers with different setup
content: I have my gmail account on Thunderbird on Windows 10 and Pop_OS. The Windows has local folders the Pop does not. What happens to the emails on the machine without? I was trying to make room on Windows for a dualboot. I copied everthing to usb then accidentally deleted my user files. 1)How do I recover the local folders from the usb? And/or 2)Do I even need to since I have Thunderbird on Pop? My concern is that, since I set up local folders on Windows, that those emails never got sent to the Pop machine. Otherwise, they all might be there and I just have to locate them which means I don't have to restore the Windows emails.
